narrative=Rebecca Green was reported missing from her home on West Bridge Street, Falkirk. Known as a mental health facility patient, Rebecca had recently experienced a period of distress. Before she disappeared, she disconnected her utilities and did not mention her plans to anyone. On the day of her disappearance, she had a planned meeting with her colleague, Josh Anderson, near the West Murrayfield Zoo in Stirling, but never arrived. Concerned, her son informed the authorities. After a meticulous search by the police, Rebecca was located safe on Bruce Street, Alloa, unharmed but disoriented.

narrative=Rebecca Green was last seen leaving her home on West Bridge Street, Falkirk, around noon. According to her aunt, Rebecca mentioned she was planning to visit the nearby homeowners association meeting before heading to the zoo. Concerns arose when Rebecca didn't return home that evening. Witnesses later reported seeing her at the casino, speaking with a group of unidentified individuals. Her absence became unsettling when personal items were discovered in the zoo bathroom, suggesting she may have been there. The situation resolved when a member of the public recognized Rebecca’s description, leading authorities to locate her safely at the West Lodge Gardens in Alloa, two days later.

narrative=Rebecca Green, a site engineer residing at 17 Whitehouse Road, had been missing since a late evening when she left a casino in Stirling. Prior to her disappearance, she had been observed being particularly disconnected from her colleague during a visit to a local zoo. The day she went missing, neighbors reported unusual activity at her home on Ercall Road, Brightons, as utilities were disconnected before her departure. Rebecca had mentioned feeling overwhelmed to her aunt, but no one anticipated her disappearing. It wasn't until later when the police traced her to a bathroom at 33 Spittal Street that her case was resolved, much to the relief of her brother, Aaron Taylor.

narrative=Rebecca Green, a site engineer, was last seen leaving her home on West Bridge Street, Falkirk. Before her disappearance, she had disconnected utilities, raising concerns among her family. During this time, her mood was reported to be unstable, contributing to her disappearance. Her uncle, Barry Green, reported her missing. Initial searches included local fields and nearby locations such as the zoo at Foundry Loan, Larbert. Rebecca was eventually traced by her family to an address on Spittal Street where she had been staying voluntarily, confirming there was no immediate danger to her well-being.

narrative=Rebecca Green, known as an accomplished engineer, unexpectedly disconnected the utilities at her home on West Bridge Street before going missing. Though her mental health struggles were known, her presence at the casino was unexpected, sparking a brief investigation before she was safely returned home.

narrative=Rebecca Green was reported missing after her son failed to contact her throughout the day. Concerns arose when Rebecca, known for her punctuality, did not appear at the meeting. Barry Green, her uncle, attempted to reach her several times but received no response.
